questions.question: You have the obligation to stop the vehicle immediately when signaled by:

options.text: Members of school traffic patrols at pedestrian crossings near schools;
Authorized personnel from the Ministry of Transport
Workers from the road administration.

questions.question: Specify situations where voluntary parking (stationing) is forbidden?

options.text: In front of access roads leading to properties adjacent to public roads
In crowded markets
On slopes and ramps.

questions.question: Is it allowed to stand (park) on the roadway during the night on an unlit country road?

options.text: Yes, if the position (parking) lights are on
No, in all cases it is prohibited to park on the carriageway at night
Yes, if other than the position lights, the presence of the car is also indicated with reflective triangles.

questions.question: The driver is prohibited from:

options.text: Throwing objects, substances or other goods from the vehicle
Opening the doors if the vehicle is stopped or stationed (parked) on the roadway
Using the horn fitted to the car.

questions.question: Can a driver carry objects whose dimensions, together with load, exceed the dimensions of the car?

options.text: Yes, if the extremities of the objects are marked with red flags
No
Yes, if the objects exceed do not the width of the vehicle.

questions.question: On meeting the indicator, you will be required:

options.text: To move carefully as it follows a curve to the left
To change the direction of travel to the left
To reduce speed, as a dangerous intersection will follow.

questions.question: On highways, at night, you will travel:

options.text: With no lights
With the position lights on
Using the low beam.

questions.question: The horn is used:

options.text: Whenever necessary to avoid any immediate danger
When you pass by cyclists
In villages, in the vicinity of pedestrian crossings.

questions.question: Is it allowed, to install or use systems that disrupt the functioning of traffic surveillance devices?

options.text: Yes
No
This is not legally established.

questions.question: Drivers of vehicles must obey traffic laws, general and specific, in the following order:

options.text: Signals, instructions and directives of traffic cops; special signs, light or sound warnings from priority traffic regime vehicles; temporary signs
Signals, instructions and directives of traffic cop; temporary signs; special signs, light or sound warnings from priority traffic regime vehicles
Special signs, light or sound warnings from priority traffic regime vehicles; signals, instructions and directives of traffic cop; temporary signs.

questions.question: A traffic policeman has the right to confiscate:

options.text: Unauthorized seatbelts
Gadgets that detect the speed of measuring devices
Devices that disrupt the operation of traffic surveillance equipment.

questions.question: What technical conditions must a vehicle meet in order to operate on public roads?

options.text: Not to exceed the maximum authorized total mass recorded in the certificate of incorporation
Not to exceed the gauge (size, caliber) written in the certificate of incorporation
To be registered and comply with technical regulations.

questions.question: At the signal of blind people crossing the street you are required:

options.text: To reduce speed and drive carefully
To stop the vehicle
To reduce speed and horn.

questions.question: Towing a car is done with:

options.text: A technically approved (homologated) flexible connection of 3-5 m, if the steering mechanism and brakes are not defective
A rigid bar, up to 4 m long
A metal bar, accompanied by a safety chain.

questions.question: At what distance must a driver use a horn to alert pedestrians and other drivers?

options.text: The law doesn’t provide a certain distance
From at most 30 m
From at least 25 m.

questions.question: What will you do, when driving at night, in weather conditions that provide poor visibility?

options.text: Stop and wait for the atmospheric conditions to change
Use the high beam and drive closer to the right edge of the road
Use the low beam and signal by changing low beam and high beam, when passing through undirected intersections.

questions.question: In order to drive on public roads, vehicles must be equipped with:

options.text: A fire extinguisher
A first aid medical kit
Two reflective triangles.

questions.question: At the request of traffic police and other relevant authorities, the driver shall:

options.text: Present travel documents
Transport them to the police
Allow the inspection of the technical condition of the vehicle and the goods transported.

questions.question: In which situation can a vehicle be immobilized?

options.text: When there is information or evidence that it is the object of a contravention
When it has serious damage to the steering system
When it is unable to move due to a damaged engine.

questions.question: Is stationing (parking) prohibited in the area of a continuous longitudinal marking?

options.text: No
Yes, if the drivers of other vehicles have to cross over that mark
Legally it is not provided.

questions.question: When it rains will you switch on the rear fog lights?

options.text: Yes, if equipped
Yes
No.

questions.question: What categories of persons are exempted from the obligation to wear seat belts?

options.text: Children under 3 years, but transported in approved restraints
Drivers when performing the reverse maneuver or when stationary
Young people who have not turned 14 years old.

questions.question: Is it allowed to open the doors when stopping or stationing (parking) on a public road?

options.text: Yes, only after the driver or passenger has ensured that it is not dangerous for the traffic
Yes, only on roads with low traffic
Yes, but only on the right side.

questions.question: Alcohol, even in small amounts:

options.text: Can diminish a driver’s attention leading to risky situations during driving
Can reduce the visual capacity
Can reduce hearing.

questions.question: The traffic police can Immobilize a vehicle when:

options.text: They lack reflective triangles
They lack a first aid medical kit
The driver refuses to identify himself.

questions.question: Which of the following types of road is the most dangerous in rain?

options.text: Paved surface roads
Concrete roads
Cubic (cobble) stone roads.

questions.question: You intend to consult a roadmap at night. How is recommended to proceed?

options.text: Stop, with the low beam on
Stop the vehicle outside the roadway
You are not allowed to see the map at night.

questions.question: What cars are allowed to stop on the second row, next to other stationed (parked vehicles) on the right side of the road?

options.text: All those who have something urgent to solve
Taxis, when boarding passengers, if traffic permits
Any car.

questions.question: What should you consider when you allow children to get in or descend from the car you are driving?

options.text: Children are allowed to get in or descend only from the sidewalk
Children are allowed to get in or descend from any side
You should not do anything, because children always behave correctly in traffic.

questions.question: What obligations does a driver have if he observes events threatening traffic safety?

options.text: To signal oncoming traffic, by alternating the high beam with the low beam
To sound the horn whenever he meets oncoming vehicles
To notify the nearest police station about obstacles or events that threaten traffic safety.

questions.question: Who is not required to wear seat belts?

options.text: Passengers in taxis
Persons who are suffering from ailments.
The examiner during the practical exam test.

questions.question: The driver of a vehicle shall:

options.text: Not allow passengers to use the mobile phone while driving
Have his identity card, driving license, registration certificate, and, where appropriate, professional certificate and other documents required by the law;
Check tire pressure before every drive.

questions.question: You drive through a locality, behind a vehicle whose registration number in from another city or from abroad. What can you expect?

options.text: The vehicle in front of you will travel correctly
Before changing directions, the driver will signal in time
The driver in front can brake or stop unexpectedly to ask for directions.

questions.question: The owner of a vehicle is obliged to:

options.text: Announce relocation details to state authorities within 24 hours
Declare the value of the car insurance to the fiscal body
Declare the loss, theft or destruction of registration certificate to the issuing authority, within 48h.

questions.question: During rain you will drive using the:

options.text: High-beam
Low-beam
Parking (position) lights.

questions.question: You are required to use the low beam during the day:

options.text: On all types of roads
On county, municipal and local roads
On motorways, expressways and national European roads.

questions.question: How will you signal that the vehicle has a failure and stalled on the carriageway?

options.text: By using the parking (position) lights
By installing the reflective triangles and using the emergency (blinking) lights
By wearing a reflective vest.

questions.question: How do you maintain the brightness of headlights in bad weather?

options.text: By periodic adjustments to the headlights
By maintaining clean headlights at all times
By using only the high-beam.

questions.question: What consequences may result from transporting luggage on the car?

options.text: You cannot make turns
The instability of the vehicle increases during crosswinds
The braking distance reduces.

questions.question: What do you do to stay alert throughout the drive?

options.text: Drive tensed, with the face close to the windshield, to see everything that happens on the road in front of you
Focus attention, but adopt a relaxed driving posture, with full control over all road maneuvers which impact the safety of your trip
Find a more enjoyable pursuit, such as listening to the radio, discussions with passengers or using the cell phone.

questions.question: What does a driver do at night, when blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle?

options.text: Switches on or keeps the long beam in order to better observe the road in the direction of travel
Alternates the long beam and low beam, to warn the other driver of his incorrect driving
Keeps driving with the short beam, reduces speed and stops if necessary.

questions.question: Wearing a seatbelt is mandatory when driving on local roads?

options.text: No
Yes, but only by the driver
Yes, by the driver and the passengers occupying seats equipped with seatbelts.

questions.question: On a stretch of icy road, you realize the inevitable impact with a dog. How do you proceed to avoid an accident?

options.text: You consider that such a situation cannot be happening to you
Release the throttle, hold the steering wheel firmly in the direction of travel, being prepared to stabilize the vehicle after the impact by smoothly handling the steering wheel
Try, if possible, to avoid frontal impact by handling the steering wheel in the opposite direction of the dog.

questions.question: In which of the situations, at night, must drivers change from the high beam to the low beam?

options.text: When the road is unlit
When they travel in towns, on roads with several lanes
If an oncoming vehicle is approaching, at a distance of at least 200 m.

questions.question: What do you do when you enter a poorly lit tunnel during the day?

options.text: Horn
Switch on the low beam
Start flashing the warning lights.

questions.question: Which vehicles have the right of way (priority) when crossing an undirected intersection?

options.text: Heavy trucks
Vehicles belonging to the Civil Protection, marked as such
Ambulances, with special light and sound signals.

questions.question: What is forbidden in this situation?

options.text: To stop or station (park)
To overtake other vehicles, except bicycles or carts
To drive on the marking applied on the carriageway.

questions.question: A damaged vehicle cannot move in traffic if:

options.text: It has broken car body parts
More than 30 days have passed from the date of damage
More than 3 days have passed from the reporting date.

questions.question: What do you do to use your cell phone when you do not have a hands-free system?

options.text: Stop on the lane meant for stationing (parking)
Stop in the parking lot of a service complex
Phones can be used without restrictions.

questions.question: A car is equipped with safety belts for all seats. Who is required to use them?

options.text: People in rear seat
All persons
People in the front seats.

questions.question: What substances have an effect similar to that of alcohol and may reduce a driver’s ability to concentrate?

options.text: Very hot spices
Medicines or substances with a psychoactive effect
Caffeine.

questions.question: When travelling on public roads it is prohibited:

options.text: To transport children, under the age of 12 years, on the back seat
To smoke while driving
For occupants in the front seat to keep pets in their arms.

questions.question: Hazard (blinking) warning lights are used in the following situation:

options.text: When you are confused about the route to follow
When the vehicle is immobilized on the carriageway or while you are towed
When the lights are broken.

questions.question: The cautious driver is considering:

options.text: Being rested, and, for the vehicle to be in good technical condition
To maintain normal pressure at the spare tire
To find out from other drivers where RADAR units are located.

questions.question: What types of vehicles are required to use the low beam during daytime?

options.text: Vehicles towing other vehicles or when transporting dangerous goods
Vehicles that move at high speed
Public transport vehicles.

questions.question: The driver's field of vision is reduced when:

options.text: The speed is increased
The dimensions of the windscreen and the rear window are smaller
Road signs are small.

questions.question: What is the specific signaling for reverse driving?

options.text: Honking intermittently to warn road users behind the vehicle
Signaling the reverse movement with the reversing lights of the vehicle
Using of emergency lights.

questions.question: What obligations do you have when driving a car at night and you approach another vehicle in front of you?

options.text: To reduce speed and drive carefully
No to engage in overtaking it
Use the low beam at a distance of at least 100 m.

questions.question: Is the holder of a category B driving license allowed to drive a car with trailer?

options.text: Yes, provided he has had a driving license for at least three years
Yes, if the trailer weight doesn’t exceed 750 kg
No, because for such a trailer you require a driving license for the category BE.

questions.question: The incorrect use of the high beam, at night, when meeting an oncoming vehicle is sanctioned by:

options.text: The Suspension of the right to drive, if the offence was committed repeatedly
The cancellation of driving license
Fine and penalty points.

questions.question: How is a B category vehicle defined correctly?

options.text: A vehicle not exceeding 5000 kg, whose number of seats, excluding that of the driver’s is less than 8
A vehicle not exceeding 3500 kg, whose number of seats, excluding that of the driver’s is not more than 8
A vehicle not exceeding 3500 kg, whose number of seats, excluding that of the driver’s, is not more than 5.

questions.question: Children aged up to 12 years can be transported:

options.text: In the front seat of the vehicle, if they are held in the arms by an adult
In the front seat of the car, having the seatbelt fixed
In the back seat of the vehicle with the seatbelt fixed and adapted to their weight and size.

questions.question: In which of the situations is it forbidden to drive on public roads?

options.text: When the registration certificate is damaged
When the vehicle is not insured against third party property damage in traffic accidents, as specified by the law
When the driver has not paid the tax to use public roads.

questions.question: Driver fatigue and nervous tension can be reduced if:

options.text: You drive at a speed that is safe, by maintaining a constant driving pace
You drive at the same speed, in both localities and outside them
You use calming or energizing drugs which are not prohibited for drivers.

questions.question: What obligations do you have, if you observe events endangering traffic safety?

options.text: To signal oncoming traffic
To use the horn
To notify the nearest police station about events that endanger traffic safety.

questions.question: What do you keep in mind to avoid an accident, in this case?

options.text: The person is walking correctly on the crosswalk
The person may turn around and run on the crosswalk without any reason
The person is carefully following the traffic and acts as such.

questions.question: In this case, besides the low beam you must use:

options.text: Fog lights
High-beam
Signaling lights.

questions.questionsNumber: 68 What do you do when a school bus stops with the hazard (blinking) lights on?
questions.question: What do you do when a school bus stops with the hazard (blinking) lights on?

options.text: The flashing of warning lights requires you to stop
Travel with heightened attention
You have no obligation.

questions.question: When is a driver obliged to stop?

options.text: When signaled by leaders of organized groups travelling on roads
When signaled by traffic school patrols at pedestrian crossings near schools
When approaching an intersection or when signaled by another road user.

questions.question: When a heavy vehicle meets a lighter vehicle on a narrow road, to facilitate crossing, the reversemaneuver has to be performed by:

options.text: The lighter vehicle
The heavy vehicle
They negotiate.

questions.question: Wearing seatbelts is not compulsory in towns for:

options.text: Children up to 12 years of age
Persons who possess a document to this effect, issued by a specialized medical institution
Women with visible pregnancy.

questions.question: How should you signal the intention to overtake another vehicle at night, on an unlit road, in a city?

options.text: With the headlights
By using the high-beam and horn
With the direction indicating lights.

questions.question: Are you allowed to horn a cyclist before overtaking?

options.text: Yes, if the distance is more than 25 m
No
Only in short bursts.

questions.question: What types of vehicles are required to drive using the low beam during the day?

options.text: Motorcycles and mopeds
Vehicles accompanying military vehicles or transporting groups of people
Vehicles towing other vehicles or when transporting dangerous goods.

questions.question: What is prohibited for drivers and tram drivers?

options.text: To use mobile phones while driving, without the hands-free system
To use the hazard warning lights within localities
To engage in discussions with other passengers.

questions.question: When must you measure tire pressure?

options.text: Before leaving on a trip, when the tires are cold
After the completion of at least 400-500 km, when the tires are warm
Only when we see that the vehicle is leaning to one side.

questions.question: What should you do to avoid a traffic accident?

options.text: Do not drive the car unless some serious problem warrants it
Always have a good partner, who knows the route
Anticipate and counter reckless driving maneuvers by other drivers and always follow the rules.

questions.question: At what distance, to a vehicle approaching from the opposite direction, is a driver required to use the low beam, at night?

options.text: At least 100 m
At least 150 m
At least 200 m.

questions.question: What should you consider when entering into a car?

options.text: To enter only from side of the sidewalk
To open the door only when traffic permits
Enter without any concern, because vehicles traveling from behind are forced to wait.

questions.question: The validity of periodic technical inspection can be found:

options.text: In a document issued by the service
In the annexure to a vehicle’s registration certificate
In the technical manual of your vehicle or trailer.

questions.question: Is parking a car on the sidewalk allowed, if you provide a space of at least 1 m on the footpath for pedestrians?

options.text: No, as the sidewalk is reserved exclusively for pedestrians
Yes, but only in areas where regulations permit
Yes, when the vehicle must be removed from the carriageway not to hinder moving vehicles.

questions.question: In which of the situations below is it not allowed to voluntarily stop a vehicle?

options.text: At a distance of less than 50 m from railway level crossings
On mandatory pedestrian lanes
On railway or tramway platforms, if it is impeding rail or tram traffic.

questions.question: Where is stationing (parking) on the left side allowed?

options.text: On one-way streets
Under no situation
On roads with consolidated side panels.

questions.question: The horizontally outstretched left arm of a cyclist, means:

options.text: The intention to change the direction of travel to the left
The intention to stop
That he must not be overtaken.

questions.question: You can drive in a pedestrian area if:

options.text: You provide commercial services
Your lighting system is working
You live in that area.

questions.question: What action is recommended when driving on a road covered with cubic stone?

options.text: To use only the hand brake to prevent slippage
To reduce the speed in time, to avoid hasty driving maneuvers
To ride as close as possible to the axis to avoid hitting the margin of the road.

questions.question: Where do you declare the loss, theft or destruction of the driving license:

options.text: At the issuing unit
At the police station within the jurisdiction of your residence
At the nearest police station.

questions.question: At the request of an owner, when the record of a vehicle be deleted?

options.text: At any change in data regarding vehicle identification
At the change of residence or premises of the owner
When the owner provides proof of dismantling, scrapping or giving away a vehicle to specialized units, for dismantling.

questions.question: Can a car trailer be parked at night on the highway?

options.text: No
Yes, if the road is illuminated
Yes, if it is marked with reflective triangles.

questions.question: How will you proceed if the intersection is blocked by congested traffic?

options.text: Stop and wait for the intersection to be decongested and then continue moving if the traffic lights are still green
Continue moving as the green signal allows you to
Horn and advance to join other vehicles in front.

questions.question: How can you park (station) a vehicle on a road which is illuminated, at night?

options.text: With all lights off
Only with the position (parking) lights on
Only with the hazard warning (blinking) lights on.

questions.question: What obligations does a driver have, if he has obtained the driving license less than a year ago?

options.text: To drive with the approved beginners sign stuck on the windshield
To horn when overtaking
To drive with the high beam, during daytime.

questions.question: Is it allowed to stop beside a tram station that has a pedestrian platform?

options.text: Yes, if the tram is not in station
Yes, because in such stations overtaking is allowed
No.

questions.question: In a residential area, marked as such:

options.text: Children cannot play on the road
Pedestrians can use the full width of the carriageway
The maximum speed is 30 km/h.

questions.question: It is forbidden to voluntarily stop:

options.text: At pedestrian crossings or less than 25 m, before and after them
At a distance of less than 100 m before and after the railway level crossing
At a distance of less than 50 m before and after public transport stations.

questions.question: A category B driving license is valid for a vehicle with more than eight seats, other than that of the driver?

options.text: Yes, if the driver has a driving experience of at least one year
No
Yes, if the driver has a category BE driving license.

questions.question: Specify when driving instructors are exempt from wearing a seat belt:

options.text: During the hours of training with students
At all times, while driving in vehicles with the inscription ‘SCHOOL’
Legally, is not provided.

questions.question: The main factors that help a driver drive carefully are:

options.text: A positive attitude in traffic, calmness, knowledge and politeness
The skill and the ability to display the physical qualities acquired
Traffic signs and traffic policemen.

questions.question: In which of the situations is it forbidden to stop?

options.text: At a distance of less than 25 m before and after public transport stations
At a distance of less than 25 m from the corner of the intersection
At a distance of 5 m behind a tram stopped at a station that has no pedestrian platform.

questions.question: How should a driver drive on a road which has more than three or more lanes?

options.text: To drive on the lane located close to the margin
Not to drive on the tram lines
To drive at a speed lesser than 100 km/h on the second and third lane.

questions.question: A vehicle's hazard warning (blinking) lights are on. What should you consider?

options.text: The vehicle will turn right or left
The vehicle is parked
The vehicle has a failure or is being towed.

questions.question: What obligations does a driver have when travelling in a border area?

options.text: To stop the vehicle promptly when a border guard signals so
To reduce speed below the legal limit
To drive with the low beam, as it is a border area.

questions.question: What should a driver do, if medication was prescribed to him?

options.text: To ensure that it will not affect the ability to drive
Not to take the medication before driving
To be aware of the lowest dose that can be taken while driving a vehicle.

questions.question: A white cane, raised by a pedestrian crossing a street on a marked or unmarked place, will:

options.text: Impose no obligation on you, because the place is not marked or signaled
Require you to stop the vehicle immediately to allow the pedestrian to cross
Require you to reduce speed and drive carefully.

questions.question: Stopping vehicles is prohibited:

options.text: On the carriageway of national roads
In the action area of the indicator ‘Stopping prohibited’ until the first intersection
In front of access roads, leading to properties adjacent to public roads.

questions.question: You cannot drive a car if:

options.text: It exceeds the maximum allowed weight, registered in the registration certificate
The tires are of different sizes and characteristics, than those in the registration certificate
The vehicle’s height exceeds the height recorded in the certificate of registration.

questions.question: A bus in front signals to exit from a station that has a bus bay. What do you do?

options.text: You go around it, to avoid pedestrians
You reduce speed and stop if necessary, to permit its departure from the bus station
Keep driving, because you have no restrictions.

questions.question: In what situations, during daytime, are drivers forced to use the low beam?

options.text: When they are towing other vehicles
When they travel on county roads
When driving at low speeds.

questions.question: In which situation is it allowed to use the horn, when horning is prohibited?

options.text: At pedestrian crossings
In undirected intersections
Whenever necessary to avoid any immediate danger.
